Trainers and Training Compatibility
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Trainers and Training Compatibility
By Kurasu Soratobu on Saturday, March 22, 2003 - 10:48 am:

I've been keeping an eye on how the trainers work. I've noticed (as I'm sure you all have) that you can put a trainer in a specific training and get the message 'he seems to be well-suited for this training' or 'He doesn't seem suited for this training'. While I haven't done any sort of examination on numbers to see what bonuses and penalties these make, I can assume that you get better numbers if they're well-suited, and worse if they aren't (well d'uh, Kurasu!). However, what I'm looking for proof on is what trainers are and aren't good in.

For instance, I have a hengar at the moment that I was trying to raise for a defense trainer. His stats are 621/717/593/152/951/989. His gains are B/A/B/C/D/D. And when I try him on trainings, he seems 'really suited' to Skill (A) and Intelligence (B), and doesn't seem suited to Defense and Life (both D), which are quite obviously his highest stats. That would suggest that at B-A, they'd be 'suited'. However, the score is neutral at Power, which he's also at a 'B' in.

If people could give me a hand with this and post up trainer breeds (main breed and sub-breed... wouldn't mind knowing if it has any effect), present stats, and what trainings they're paticularly good in, it'd be most appreciated. I want to see if the pattern is in the numbers, in the stat gain, in both, or what. It'd be nice to have a good, solid list of what monsters are good for what trainings, after all.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 01:52 am:

*bump*

Ok, guys? I had some advantages with the MR2 baseline stats, thanks to the CD list and some advance studies. I kinda don't have as much basis here. Which means I'll have 512 monsters to go through on my own. As opposed to 408 with some help.

I've got 6 purebreeds checked (Arrowhead, Durahan, Garu, Hengar, Raiden, Zan), three crosses (Nagi/Mocchi, Suzarin/Golem, Tiger/Hare), and two special breeds (Torridon Ducken, Valkyrie Pixie). Can anyone add to this with some trainers of theirs? It only takes a minute or so to check.

By Gizmo the Lemur on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 09:41 am:

Sure, Kurasu. I am not sure if this is the info you want (if it isn't, the mods can go ahead and delete this post), but here goes nothing:

Archreaper (Joker/Sp-L)
Pow Int Acc Spd Def Lif
727 999 999 999 521 999

Great with*:
All except for Body Blow

---

Fair Moch (Mocchi/Gali)
Pow Int Acc Spd Def Lif
585 999 999 999 344 999

Great with:
All of them for some odd reason

---

White Mew (Mew/Sp)
Pow Int Acc Spd Def Lif
574 792 639 609 494 506

Great with:
All of them like Fair Moch (I kid you not).

---

*According to Fran in AGIMA.

Yeah, I am wondering how could my Fair Moch and White Mew be sitable for each drill where as my Archreaper is great with everyone, but body blow.
My guess are either certain subs determine the coaches effectiveness (Remember how you started out with a Mocchi/Gali in the beginning of mra2?), or the breeds stat might be partly responsible for their usefulness.

However, the problem with my stat gain argument is that Mew and Mocchi are lousy with gaining points in Def. Sorry if this doesn't help you with anything.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 12:25 pm:

It's exactly what I'm looking for, Gizmo. I hadn't considered that a monster might not be 'good' in all the different trainings. I'd been assuming if it was good in one Defense-first training, it was good in both of them (for instance). I'll have to look back and see.

I'm also inclined to agree: the subs do seem to have some definite effect on things. I'm not sure whether it's because of stat gains or breed-specific advantages, though.

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, April 2, 2003 - 01:43 pm:

I tend to agree with that estimate too, but I distinctly remember that the first coach (that mocchi) was not good or bad at any drill. I only remember because I was new to assigning a coach and I tried him in everything.
